content: A recent audit of Eastern Coastal Health Network revealed a 32% increase in orthopedic claims among beneficiaries aged 55-70, particularly for knee arthroplasty procedures. The spike correlates with Policy OP-9924's expanded coverage for minimally invasive techniques. Documentation submitted between January-March 2024 shows Dr. Ellen Voss at Mariner's Point Orthopedics accounted for 18% of these claims, frequently pairing procedures with aquatic therapy scripts.
